results.adx_keywords: Food Network;Deen, Paula;Discrimination;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Today (TV Program);Race and Ethnicity
results.title: Food Network Drops Paula Deen
results.abstract: The network announced Friday that it would not renew Ms. Deen’s contract at the end of June, after she apologized for using racist language.

media.caption: Paula Deen cooking on the “Today” show earlier this year.
Paula Deen issued an apology on a YouTube video on Friday.

results.adx_keywords: Gandolfini, James;Actors and Actresses;Deaths (Obituaries);The Sopranos (TV Program);Television;Movies;Home Box Office;Sopranos, The (TV Program)
results.title: James Gandolfini Is Dead at 51; a Complex Mob Boss in ‘The Sopranos’
results.abstract: Mr. Gandolfini won three Emmy Awards for his lead role as a New Jersey mob kingpin on the HBO drama.

media.caption: James Gandolfini in a scene from "The Sopranos."

results.adx_keywords: Snowden, Edward J;National Security Agency;Hong Kong;Surveillance of Citizens by Government;United States International Relations;Russia;Ecuador;Classified Information and State Secrets
results.byline: By PETER BAKER and ELLEN BARRY
results.title: Snowden, in Russia, Seeks Asylum in Ecuador
results.abstract: Edward J. Snowden arrived in Moscow on Sunday as American officials pressed Russia to turn him over and warned countries in Latin America not to harbor him or allow him passage.

media.caption: On Sunday, a crowd of journalists greeted a passenger on the same Hong Kong flight Edward J. Snowden took to Moscow.
media.copyright: James Hill for The New York Times

media.caption: The car of Ecuador’s ambassador at the Moscow airport. Ecuador confirmed getting an asylum request from Mr. Snowden.

results.adx_keywords: Abortion;Washington (State)
results.title: My Abortion, at 23 Weeks
results.abstract: Second-trimester abortions must remain legal because critical information about fetal health is often not available before then.

results.adx_keywords: Sao Paulo (Brazil);Free Fare Movement;Demonstrations, Protests, and Riots;World Cup 2014 (Soccer);Prices (Fares, Fees and Rates);Rio de Janeiro (Brazil);Buses;Brazil
results.title: Thousands Gather for Protests in Brazil’s Largest Cities
results.abstract: What began with small protests against bus-fare increases has evolved into a broader indictment of the country’s high cost of living and lavish new stadium projects.

media.caption: Protesters in São Paulo called for lower public transportation fares.
media.copyright: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times

media.caption: Military police sprayed a protester with pepper spray during demonstrations in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, on Monday.

results.adx_keywords: Snowden, Edward J;Classified Information and State Secrets;Surveillance of Citizens by Government;United States International Relations;Fugitives;National Security Agency;Russia;China;Hong Kong;Ecuador
results.byline: By PETER BAKER and ELLEN BARRY
results.title: Leaker’s Flight Raises Tension Between U.S. and 3 Nations
results.abstract: The Obama administration escalated its criticism on Monday of Russia, China and Ecuador, the countries that appeared to be protecting Edward J. Snowden, who is wanted on spying charges.

media.caption: With Edward J. Snowden apparently in hiding in Moscow, journalists gathered Monday at the Ecuadorean Embassy there.
media.copyright: James Hill for The New York Times

media.caption: Jay Carney, the White House press secretary, said, “We do not buy the suggestion that China could not have taken action.”
The passenger plane, flight SU 150 to Havana, from Moscow Sheremetyevo airport, on Monday before it took off without Edward J. Snowden.

results.adx_keywords: medicine and health; Sleep; Medicine and Health
results.title: Cheating Ourselves of Sleep
results.abstract: Failing to get enough sleep night after night can compromise your health and may even shorten your life.

results.adx_keywords: Athletics and Sports; Carney, Reeve; Exercise; Heart; McDougall, Christopher; medicine and health; Reduced Shakespeare Company; Medicine and Health
results.title: The 4-Minute Workout
results.abstract: A single, strenuous four-minute workout can effectively improve health and fitness as much as longer workouts can, researchers found. Download the “Well 4-Minute Workout” playlist for your workout.

results.adx_keywords: Nye, Bill;Science and Technology;Bill Nye the Science Guy (TV Program)
results.title: Firebrand for Science, and Big Man on Campus
results.abstract: William Sanford Nye, better known as Bill Nye the Science Guy, has gone from TV host to fierce defender of scientific issues that have been polemicized for religious, political and even economic reasons.

media.caption: Bill Nye portrayed an engineering professor in an episode of the CBS show “Numbers,” with Peter MacNicol. Mr. Nye said his goal as a lecturer and entertainer was to interest young people in science.

results.adx_keywords: Amsterdam (Netherlands);Bicycles and Bicycling;Parking
results.title: The Dutch Prize Their Pedal Power, but a Sea of Bikes Swamps Their Capital
results.abstract: Bicycles, the preferred means of travel, are clogging streets and overwhelming parking spaces in Amsterdam, causing some to say the unthinkable: There are too many bikes.

media.caption: Amsterdam has more bicycles than people, and although it has thousands of bike racks, demand for them still outstrips supply.
media.copyright: Pavel Prokopchik for The New York Times

media.caption: Bicycles clog streets and cause traffic jams, but as one official put it, “You cannot imagine if all this traffic were cars.”
media.copyright: Pavel Prokopchik for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Humanities;Reading and Writing Skills (Education)
results.title: The Decline and Fall of the English Major
results.abstract: In the drift away from the humanities, we risk losing something essential in ourselves.

results.adx_keywords: United States Economy;United States;Apple Inc;General Motors;Economics (Theory and Philosophy)
results.title: Profits Without Production
results.abstract: So what’s really different about American economy in the 21st century?

media.caption: Paul Krugman
media.copyright: Fred R. Conrad/The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Snowden, Edward J;Hong Kong;Surveillance of Citizens by Government;Classified Information and State Secrets;Ho, Albert
results.title: Hasty Exit Started With Pizza Inside a Hong Kong Hideout
results.abstract: During a meeting last week, Edward J. Snowden was deeply dismayed to learn that he could spend years in prison without a computer.

media.caption: Albert Ho, one of Edward J. Snowden’s lawyers, at a rally on June 15. The Hong Kong government was said to not trust Mr. Ho, a longtime campaigner for full democracy there.
A letter Edward J. Snowden signed on June 10 to retain Albert Ho and his firm's legal services in Hong Kong.

results.adx_keywords: Supreme Court;Affirmative Action;Decisions and Verdicts;University of Texas at Austin;Ginsburg, Ruth Bader;Kennedy, Anthony M;Colleges and Universities;Race and Ethnicity;Fisher, Abigail Noel
results.title: Justices Step Up Scrutiny of Race in College Entry
results.abstract: The 7-to-1 ruling was both modest and significant, and its recalibration of how courts review the programs is likely to give rise to a wave of challenges to college admissions decisions.

media.caption: Abigail Fisher, who was denied admission to the University of Texas at Austin, said her race was held against her.
media.copyright: Luke Sharrett for The New York Times

media.caption: The scene at the Supreme Court before the decision came down. The ruling is likely to set off new challenges to affirmative action.

results.adx_keywords: Bernanke, Ben S;Federal Reserve System;United States Economy;Interest Rates
results.title: Et Tu, Bernanke?
results.abstract: The Fed loses the thread.

media.caption: Paul Krugman
media.copyright: Fred R. Conrad/The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Marijuana;California;Forests and Forestry;Environment;Poisoning and Poisons
results.title: Marijuana Crops in California Threaten Forests and Wildlife
results.abstract: California growers are acknowledging that like logging before it, their booming business is a threat to forests whose giant redwoods preside over vibrant ecosystems.

media.caption: Marijuana crops on private land in Humboldt County, Calif. Some medical marijuana growers follow state rules, but others do not.
While some marijuana farms divert and dry up streams, this grower uses conservation methods like a rainwater holding pond.
Marijuana is approved by California for medical uses but still illegal under federal law, leading to a patchwork of growers.

results.adx_keywords: Baby Boomers;Lingerie and Underwear;Shopping and Retail;Dating and Courtship;Age, Chronological;Women and Girls
results.title: Where Did You Go for Your Bra, Mrs. Robinson?
results.abstract: It’s never too late for hot lingerie.

media.caption: The author's template for hot middle-aged sexuality: Anne Bancroft in ‘"The Graduate."

results.adx_keywords: Movies;World War Z (Movie);Pitt, Brad;Forster, Marc
results.title: These Dead Don’t Walk. They Run.
results.abstract: The love-scare affair with zombies is exploited yet again in “World War Z,” with Brad Pitt as the hero trying to save the world as well as his family.

media.caption: "World War Z": Brad Pitt stars as a man struggling to save the world as well as protect his family in this movie, based on a novel by Max Brooks, opening nationwide on Friday.
Brad Pitt and Mireille Enos in the zombie film “World War Z,” directed by Marc Forster.

results.adx_keywords: Computers and the Internet; E-Mail; Social Conditions and Trends
results.title: I Know What You Think of Me
results.abstract: Hearing other people’s uncensored opinions of you is an unpleasant reminder that you’re just another person in the world.

results.adx_keywords: Brazil;Demonstrations, Protests, and Riots;Pele;Ronaldo;Soccer;World Cup 2014 (Soccer)
results.byline: By SIMON ROMERO and WILLIAM NEUMAN
results.title: How Angry Is Brazil? Pelé Now Has Feet of Clay
results.abstract: As Brazilian protests grow, even soccer comes under fire after Edson Arantes do Nascimento, the soccer legend known as Pelé, told Brazilians to “forget the protests.”

media.caption: Soccer spectators protested in Rio de Janeiro on Thursday.
In São Paulo, Brazil, residents watched construction of a stadium for a local team that will also be used for the World Cup.
media.copyright: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times
